title: No password required
content:
Yahoo has made changes recently, supposedly in the name of security, that have had quite the opposite effect for those of us who use Thunderbird for email on shared computers. Before Yahoo's recent changes, Thunderbird would ask users to enter their password before connecting to the email server. This is no longer the case. Now, when logging into Thunderbird, there is no dialog box popping up for entering a password, Thunderbird just automatically connects. This needs to be corrected. Hopefully someone at Mozilla is listening and will take action.

So far, the only work-around I have found has been to go into Account Settings, Thuderbird Preferences, Saved Passwords, and deleting the oauth password that was automatically saved when I jumped through Yahoo's hoops to get my email working again after they implemented their recent changes. This has to be done EACH SESSION and, if this is done, then the next time I want to get my email I have to repeat the process of generating a new oauth token by logging into Yahoo by way of my browser, which will then be saved once again in Thunderbird and will, once again, need to be deleted at the end of the session. This is obviously a colossal PITA.

Someone PLEASE FIX THIS!
creator: eric.nordin

title: L'estensione Mail Merge impedisce l'invio di email
content:
Premessa: sul PC ho due profili di Thunderbird, che chiamerò A (accounts personali) e B (accounts di lavoro).

Ho sempre utilizzato il profilo A come client tradizionale e il profilo B per l'invio di email con l'utilizzo di Mail Merge; da circa una settimana tuttavia non riesco più ad utilizzare Mail Merge in quanto cliccando sull'apposito pulsante per utilizzare l'estensione, non succede proprio nulla, non appare la solita finestra in cui inserire i dati per la composizione delle email.

Non solo: non riesco neanche ad inviare email in maniera standard (senza l'ausilio di Mail Merge) in quanto il pusante "Invia" si ingrigisce dopo averlo cliccato ma la finestra di invio resta lì in primo piano e posso solo chiuderla cliccando sulla "X".

Se provo ad inviare un'email senza Mail Merge, la console degli errori produce la seguente segnalazione: UnknownError: The operation failed for reasons unrelated to the database itself and not covered by any other error code. ExtensionStorageIDB.sys.mjs:841 

   normalizeStorageError resource://gre/modules/ExtensionStorageIDB.sys.mjs:841    method chrome://extensions/content/child/ext-storage.js:286    AsyncFunctionThrow self-hosted:808

Se disattivo o disinstallo l'estensione, l'invio semplice funziona normalmente.

La cosa strana è che questo comportamento si verifica solo utilizzando il profilo B; il profilo A invece funziona regolarmente, sia con Mail Merge che senza.

Qualcuno ha idea di cosa possa essere successo, considerato che non ho toccato né le impostazioni di Mail Merge, né quelle di Thunderbird e perché su un profilo sì e sull'altro no?

Un grazie a chiunque possa aiutarmi, Antonello
creator: dito65

title: IMAP & POP & SMTP
content:
Dear all,

I have three e-mail accounts on my Thunderbird: Swissmail, Freeler and Casema.

Swissmail is a POP account.

Freeler and Casema are IMAP accounts.

Question 1: How can I change a POP account to an IMAP account? Do I need to uninstall it and reconfigure it? If tat is the case how can I keep the e-mails in this account?

Question 2: Many recipients do not accept messages sent by my Swissmail or Freeler accounts but they do accept those from my Casema account. My Casema account is linked to my Internet service provider so e-mails use this as a SMTP account. How can I send e-mails from the other two accounts? Is i possible to configure a different SMTP server for each account?

Thank you for the answers.

Kind regards,

George Nielsen

title: Gestione identità per account di posta GMail su Thunderbird
content:
Salve a tutti, ho un account primario GMail al quale sono associati degli indirizzi alias. La situazione è questa:

accountprimario@dominioA.it alias1@dominioA.it alias2@dominioB.it alias3@dominioB.it

Vorrei gestire tramite le identità questa configurazione anche su Thunderbird Seguendo le indicazioni della guida sono riuscito a configurare tutto esattamente come indicato qui: https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-identita-thunderbird

Il problema è questo: qualunque sia l'indirizzo email selezionato come mittente in "Da" l'email che viene ricevuta dal destinatario riporta come mittente sempre l'account primario e mai un alias (anche quando selezionato), rendendo quindi inutile la funzionalità di gestione delle identità.

Qualcuno mi sa dire dove sta l'errore?

Grazie

My email account has received too many messages and has become full. Today, after deleting many messages, I still cannot receive any emails and I am also unable to send any.

What should I do?

Maybe can you send me your answer at an other email : martin.brnt@gmail.com. Because I can't received mail on my first email : martin.brunet01@free.fr

Thank you, Martin
creator: martin.brunet01

title: Thunderbird Outlook smtp probleem
content:
Hoi, hier sinds kort ook problemen met het versturen van mails van een @outlook.com mailadres via Thunderbird. Alles staat goed ingesteld, maar we krijgen nu telkens deze foutmelding:

| Aanmelden bij server smtp-mail.outlook.com met gebruikersnaam emailadres@outlook.com is mislukt.

Van alles gezocht en geprobeerd, maar niets werkt. Sinds enkele dagen hebben we een nieuw 'zwaarder’ modem van Odio gehad; maar ik ga er vanuit dat dat er niet mee te maken kan hebben.

Maar de vraag blijft dus: hoe versturen we nu mails van outlook via thunderbird?

We gebruiken IMAP en een gewoon privé mailadres, geen exchange adres o.i.d.
creator: sander20

title: Installing Thunderbird
content:
Is there anything that would prevent me from installing Thunderbird on an SD Card?

Also if I uninstall Thunderbird from the SD Card how would I reinstall it on a portable hard drive and move the profile and mailboxes from the SD Card to the portable hard drive. (Telling Thunderbird where to find the profiles and mailboxes.)
creator: junkmmc

title: Height of Description field in Edit event window in Calendar too small
content:
None of the topics in the drop down I was given are relevant to my question, which is about the Calendar in Thunderbird 115.12.2, on Windows 10.

When I edit an event or create a new one in the Calendar, the height of the Description window is ridiculously small, as shown in the attached screen capture. It only displays a couple of lines of text whereas my descriptions are usually far longer than that. So I always have to resize the window and TB doesn't "remember" my preferred window height, so I have to resize it every single time I create or edit an event.

Is there any workaround for this, to set the default height of the Edit Event window to a larger height than Thunderbird's default?

Dave
creator: Dave_Rado

title: Trying to follow instructions from another thread to get hotmail account to work in Thunderbird again
content:
Trying to configure Thunderbird to work with hotmail again. It stopped working a few days ago. Following the 6-step instructions at the end of the thread on this page: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1436296

At step 3 I don't have OAuth2 in the drop-down menu. Just

No authentication Normal password Encrypted password Kerberos / GSSAPI NTLM

With OAuth2 selected in the places it *is* available, I just get Host contacted, sending login information... ad infinitum.

How do I fix it? Thanks.

Thunderbird 115.15.0 on Windows 8.1
creator: matthew_tapp

title: Can't Create New Subfolders
content: I've been using Thunderbird for years on macOS with no problems. All of a sudden, as of yesterday, I can't create new folders and subfolders. I also can't rename folders. The software is up to date (128.2.3esr (64-bit)). The laptop is running macOS Sonoma v 14.6.1. I've tried restarting Thunderbird, restarting the laptop, and Googling for an answer, of course. I've also tried opening Troubleshoot Mode, that didn't make a difference. I probably have several hundred folders - it's a work account and each client has to have their own subfolder. I can't seem to find anything that says there is a limit to the number of folders, and in any event that wouldn't explain the inability to rename folders. Thunderbird is working fine otherwise.
creator: david855
